alert.note: Alert for Fountain (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 26 at 2:27PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Fountain, northwestern Parke and central Vermillion Counties through 300 PM EDT ... At 226 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Newport, or 15 miles southeast of Danville, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Fountain, northwestern Parke and central Vermillion Counties, including the following locations... Cayuga, Perrysville, Lodi, Kingman, and Yeddo. This includes Interstate 74 between mile markers 9 and 13. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
